page.title: 01EMPLOYMENT
page.content: At Dean Point, to the north of Coverack, is the Dean Quarry. The quarry provides various grades of roadstone. It is the largest employer in an area where unemployment is high. The stone is carried away by road and also by ship. The small bulk-carrying ship can often be seen tied up to a small jetty near to the quarry, and it i loaded by conveyer belt, which carries the stone out over the beach. Recently application has been made to extend the quarry, which has caused some social concern in the neighbouring area of the quarry. Local residents fear damage to their homes from blasting. Public meeting have been called to allow the people of the village of St. Keverne to voice their opinion on the subject; and opinions are varied according to interests: whether resident or quarry employee.
